segments.text: Good morning , I want a room tonight .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Single or double ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Single , please .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you have a reservation ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . I made a reservation in shanghai .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Then I believe you have a confirmation slip .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah . Let me see . Is this the one you want ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s it . What ’ s your name . please ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Wu Mei . That ’ s my name .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Just a moment , please . Yes , you have a room reservation for you .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Is this room with a bath room ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , it ’ s .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Can you give me a quiet room ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It ’ s a inside room on the eight floor .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What ’ s the room rate ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Eighty dollars a day . How long do you plan to stay Mrs Wu ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Three nights I scheduled .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you sign the register , please ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Is that right ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Thank you , Mrs Wu .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Your room Number is 827 . The bail-boy will take your bags and show you to your room .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Thanks .
segments.speaker: S2
